description: From New Latin Batrachia, former name of the zoological order Anura, from Ancient Greek βατράχεια (batrákheia), neuter plural of adjective from βάτραχος (bátrakhos, “frog”).

adjectives.description: batrachian (comparative more batrachian, superlative most batrachian)

entries.meaning: Pertaining to or resembling a frog or toad.
examples: I dig her batrachian lips / Her bulbous eyes and scaly hips
